title: Feature: CLI flag to create config file if it doesn't exist
description: Add a CLI flag (e.g., --create or --init) that creates the config file with just the letterboxing configuration if it doesn't exist.

title: Feature: XDG config directory support
description: Integrate XDG config directory support to find niri config files in the appropriate locations (e.g., ~/.config/niri/config.kdl). Use a sindre sorhus package for this.
close_reason: Implemented XDG config directory support using sindresorhus/xdg-basedir package. Created src/config.ts with getNiriConfigPath() and getNiriConfigDir() functions. Successfully resolves to ~/.config/niri/config.kdl by default, supports custom paths.

title: Evaluate KDL libraries for TypeScript
description:
Evaluate KDL libraries for TypeScript to parse niri's config.kdl files. Research identified three main options:

**Top Recommendation: @bgotink/kdl**
- 24 GitHub stars, latest version 0.4.0 (Nov 2025)
- Format-preserving parser that maintains comments and whitespace
- Native TypeScript with full type definitions
- Best for config files that humans maintain

**Alternative: kdljs (official)**
- 147 GitHub stars, latest version 0.3.0 (Jan 2025)
- Official KDL implementation with querying support (KQL)
- Good for complex queries but less format-preserving

**Decision: Evaluate @bgotink/kdl first** due to its format-preserving capabilities which are critical for config files. Test the library by:
1. Installing the package
2. Reading a sample niri config.kdl file
3. Parsing and accessing nodes
4. Testing modification and re-formatting to ensure preservation

If @bgotink/kdl works well, proceed with using it. If issues arise, fall back to kdljs.
close_reason: Successfully installed and tested @bgotink/kdl package. The library correctly parses KDL files, preserves formatting and comments, and can format parsed structures back to KDL. Ready to use for reading niri's config.kdl files.

title: Feature: Support config.kdl and alternative config file paths
description: Work with niri's config.kdl by default, but allow specifying alternative config file paths to work on.

title: Feature: Automatic backup system with datestamped versions
description:
Implement backup system that creates datestamped backups before modifying config.kdl in place. Should support:
- Automatic backup before any modification
- Datestamped filenames
- Configurable backup subdirectory

title: Feature: Implement letterboxing with gap size and position controls
description:
Create CLI to adjust display letterboxing with two percentage controls:
1. Gap size % (10%, 20%, 99% = thin squeezed line)
2. Position % (50% = middle, 0% = bottom, 100% = top)

This should be a general solution that works on the configured display output.

title: Research: Understand niri output display naming and identification

title: Create show-config subcommand to read current niri configuration
description: Create a read-config subcommand that reads and displays the current niri configuration file. This is the first step to understand the config format and prepare for modifications.
close_reason: Implemented show-config subcommand using Gunshi CLI framework. Subcommand successfully reads and displays niri configuration from XDG config directory (~/.config/niri/config.kdl). Works with both existing and missing config files (displays appropriate error message).
